question: Will the winner of the rugby Men’s 2025 Six Nations Championship have at least 5 more total competition points than the second place?
description:
*This question is part of the* [*Bridgewater Forecasting Contest*](https://www.metaculus.com/bridgewater/)*. To be eligible to win prizes in the competition you must register for the tournament. The last day to register is March 24, 2025. Sign up or check your registration status* [*here*](https://www.metaculus.com/bridgewater/)*.*

***

The [<u>Six Nations Championship</u>](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Six_Nations_Championship) is a long-running annual rugby competition between international competitors. Established in 1883 as the Home Nations Championship, between the four nations of the United Kingdom, its current iteration is between the teams of England, France, Ireland, Italy, Scotland, and Wales.

Each Championship consists of 15 matches, with each team playing the other five once. The Championship winner is determined by a [<u>points system</u>](https://www.sixnationsrugby.com/en/m6n/championship-rules) that includes Match Points, with some Match Points typically referred to as Bonus Points. If a team wins a match, they receive four Match Points. Draws result in two Match Points for each team. A single Bonus Point can be earned for each match by scoring four or more tries during the match. If a team loses a match a Bonus Point can be earned for that match by losing by seven points or fewer.

Winning all five matches is called a “Grand Slam” and earns a team an additional three Bonus Points, giving it a minimum score of 23 points. This ensures that winning a Grand Slam wins the competition, even if another team wins four of their games and maxes out their bonus points.

The [<u>2025 Six Nations Championship</u>](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_Six_Nations_Championship) is scheduled to be held from January 31, 2025, through March 15, 2025.

news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Spain to Face Portugal in Rugby Europe Championship 2025 Semi-Finals**
Spain will face Portugal in the semi-finals of the Rugby Europe Championship 2025 (REC25) in early March, after losing to Georgia 62-32 in Madrid. The match will take place in Portugal on either March 1st or 2nd, with the location and time to be determined by the federations of the two countries and Rugby Europe. Georgia won the Group A with a bonus point, securing the best performance in the group stage and a potential home final if they beat Romania in the other semi-final. Portugal won Group B with 15 points, but with a worse points difference than Georgia, and will only host the final or the third-place match if their opponent is Romania.

**Spain to Face Portugal in Rugby Europe Championship 2025 Semi-Finals**
Spain will face Portugal in the semi-finals of the Rugby Europe Championship 2025 (REC25) in early March, after losing to Georgia 62-32 in Madrid. The match will take place in Portugal on either March 1st or 2nd, with the location and time to be determined by the federations of the two countries and Rugby Europe. Georgia won the Group A with a bonus point, securing the best performance in the group stage and will play the final at home if they beat Romania in the other semi-final. Portugal won Group B with 15 points, but with a worse points difference than Georgia, so they will only play at home in the final or the third-place match if their opponent is Romania. The REC25 finals will be held on March 16th.

**Six Nations 2025: France faces a tough challenge**
The 2024 Six Nations Championship has confirmed Ireland's supremacy on the European scene. The Irish team, led by Andy Farrell, dominated the competition, winning four out of five matches and securing their second consecutive title. The only blemish on their record was a loss to England at Twickenham, which denied them a Grand Slam. France had a contrasting tournament, recovering from a disastrous start against Ireland at Marseille (17-38) to secure victories against Scotland and England, before being disappointed by a frustrating draw against Italy (13-13). This result eliminated their chances of winning the competition, and they finished second. England, in the midst of reconstruction under Steve Borthwick, showed encouraging signs despite offensive weaknesses. Italy was one of the surprises of the tournament, holding France and beating Scotland to avoid last place. Wales, on the other hand, had a disastrous tournament, finishing last with only 4 points. The 2025 Six Nations Championship is expected to be particularly challenging, with nations undergoing significant changes and young generations ready to emerge. France will need to show they can compete with Ireland, especially after narrowly losing to England last weekend, while avoiding the pitfalls set by Italy and Scotland in the coming matches. Here is a recap of the first two days of the 2025 Six Nations Championship: Day 1: January 31 - February 1, 2025 France crushes Wales The French team started their campaign in style by inflicting a heavy defeat on Wales, 43-0, at the Stade de France. The French dominated the match from start to finish, scoring seven tries. Grégory Alldritt was particularly impressive, scoring two tries and being named man of the match. Despite a solid performance, Romain Ntamack was sent off for a dangerous tackle, making him unavailable for the match against England at Twickenham the following weekend. Scotland started their tournament on a high note by beating Italy 31-19 at Murrayfield. Led by a triple from Huw Jones, the Scots dominated despite an Italian resurgence in the second half. A promising victory for the men of Gregor Townsend. Ireland began their title defense with a hard-fought victory over England (27-22) in Dublin. Led by a double from Hugo Keenan, the Irish managed to resist the English comeback in the final minutes to secure the win and a strong start to the 2025 edition. Day 2: February 8-9, 2025 A thrilling crunch match In a packed Twickenham, the French thought they had won, but England snatched victory with a killer try in the final seconds. Dominant in the scrum and realistic in attack, the English took advantage of French mistakes. France, despite two tries from Bielle-Biarrey and one from Penaud, lost by a point and saw their Grand Slam hopes slip away. The title is still possible, but an immense exploit will be needed against Ireland in Dublin on the fourth day. Ireland in charge The Irish continued to impress by dominating Scotland at Murrayfield. Led by an inspired Prendergast, the XV of the Shamrock dominated the brave but inaccurate Scots. With this victory, Ireland consolidated their position as leader and continued to believe in the Grand Slam this year. Italian exploit Rome was electrified! Italy surprised Wales with a heroic defense and an Ange Capuozzo shining performance. This victory ended a long series of defeats and relaunched the Azzurri in the tournament, while Wales continued its massive crisis, with a 14th consecutive defeat. This weekend, the tournament is on pause and will return next week, with France facing a tough challenge in Rome, while Ireland will face Wales away and must be careful not to be surprised by a Welsh revival, which could strongly prick...

Portugal also won Group B with 15 points, but with a worse points difference, so they will only play at home in the final or the third-place match if their opponent is Romania. **Galthié's Popularity Declines After French Rugby Team's Recent Defeats**
Fabien Galthié, the coach of the French rugby team, has seen his popularity decline after the team's recent defeats, including a loss to England in the 6 Nations tournament. According to a recent survey by Odoxa for Winamax and RTL, 72% of French people still believe that Galthié is a good coach, but this is a 19-point decrease from September 2023, when the team was considered a strong contender for the World Cup. The team's recent performance has been disappointing, including a loss to South Africa in the World Cup quarterfinals and a second-place finish in the 2024 6 Nations tournament behind Ireland. Galthié's team has already said goodbye to the Grand Slam and will have to bounce back in Italy next weekend. Despite this, 62% of rugby fans still believe that the French team will win the 6 Nations tournament, although 77% of respondents find the loss to England 'incomprehensible'.

**French Team's Loss to England in Six Nations 2025 Tournament Deemed 'Incomprehensible' by 65% of French People**
A recent survey conducted by Odoxa for Winamax and RTL found that 65% of French people and 77% of rugby enthusiasts found the French team's loss to England in the Six Nations 2025 tournament 'incomprehensible'. Only 62% of respondents were satisfied with the tactics of coach Fabien Galthié, 61% with the team's cohesion, and 60% with the players' combativeness. However, 62% of rugby enthusiasts still believe that the French team will win the tournament, although their optimism has decreased by 11 points since the start of the competition. The survey also found that Fabien Galthié's popularity has decreased significantly, with 72% of respondents considering him a good coach, a 19-point decrease from September 2023 when 91% of respondents held this view. The survey was conducted online among a representative sample of 1,005 people aged 18 and over, including 421 rugby enthusiasts.

**Six Nations Round Three: Fixtures, kick-off times, referees and global TV channels**
The 2025 Six Nations Championship returns with Round Three after a week's break. Ireland leads the standings with 10 points, followed by France and England with six points each. Scotland has five points, Italy has four, and Wales is last with one point. Wales has a new head coach, Matt Sherratt, who will lead the team against Ireland in the first match of the round at the Principality Stadium. The Calcutta Cup clash between England and Scotland will follow, and Italy will host France in the final game of the round at the Stadio Olimpico. France is looking to bounce back from their shock defeat to England. As Matt Sherratt said, 'It's a great opportunity for us to get back on track and show what we're capable of.'

**Portugal Defeats Romania 34-6 in Rugby Europe Championship 2025**
Romania's national rugby team was defeated by Portugal with a score of 34-6 (12-3) on Saturday evening at Botoșani, in the Rugby Europe Championship 2025. The Romanian team scored only two penalty kicks, by Alin Conache (21, 56). The Portuguese team achieved five tries, by Rafaele Storti (14), Luka Begic (31), Nicolas Martins (42), Manuel Vareiro (64) and Vasco Baptista (78), three conversions by Sadro Marques (32, 43) and one by Vareiro (79). Marques also scored a penalty kick (61). With this success, Portugal won Group B with 15 points, followed by Romania with 9 points. Portugal will play at home in the semi-finals against the second-placed team in Group A (1-2 March), while Romania will play away against the winner of Group A, where Georgia and Spain have 10 points each, before the direct match on Sunday in Madrid. In their first match of the year, Romania defeated Germany 48-10, and then defeated Belgium 31-14 away in Mons. Portugal is the leader of Group B, after beating Belgium 40-30 and Germany 56-14. Portugal, Romania, Georgia, and Spain have qualified directly for the 2027 World Cup.

**Portugal Secures Top Spot in Rugby Europe Championship 2025**
Portugal secured the top spot in Group B of the Rugby Europe Championship 2025 by defeating Romania 34-6 away, earning them a home semifinal against either Spain or Georgia. The Portuguese team achieved the bonus point for a difference of three or more tries, with five unanswered tries from Raffaele Storti, Luka Begic, Nicolas Martins, Manuel Vareiro, and Vasco Baptista. Two conversions and a penalty from Samuel Marques, as well as another conversion from Manuel Vareiro, sealed the result. Portugal now awaits the outcome of the Spain vs. Georgia match on Sunday to determine their semifinal opponent. If the winner of that match does not earn a bonus point, Portugal will secure the best group stage performance, granting them the right to host the final or the third-place match. The final standings of the REC25 will determine the European teams' seeding for the 2027 World Cup draw, alongside the 12 teams directly qualified from the 2023 France tournament.

**Ireland solidifies its position as top favorite to win the Six Nations Championship**
Ireland solidified its position as the top favorite to win the Six Nations Championship with a convincing 32-18 victory over Scotland, placing them alone in first place in the standings after two rounds. The Irish team is the only one to have won both of its first two matches, with a bonus point in both, and leads with 10 points, followed by France and England, who are tied with 6 points after France's narrow 26-25 win over England on Saturday. In the next round, Ireland will visit a struggling Wales, who have lost 14 consecutive matches, after their defeat to Italy on Saturday. The match was almost decided in the first half, with a 17-5 difference, and Scotland lost two key players, Finn Russell and Darcy Graham, who collided with each other in a defensive action. Despite their efforts, the home team was unable to recover. Meanwhile, Spain secured its spot in the 2027 Rugby World Cup by winning the Rugby Europe Championship, and will join Portugal, Georgia, and Romania in the tournament. The 24-team World Cup will be held in Australia for the first time. 'It's a ray of light for rugby in Spain,' said a source, after the country was disqualified from the last two editions of the tournament due to alignment irregularities. 'We're thrilled to have secured a spot in the World Cup, and we're looking forward to the challenge.'

**England Edges Out France in Thrilling Six Nations Match**
In the second round of the Six Nations Rugby Championship, England and France, the leaders of the tournament, faced off at Twickenham Stadium in London. France initially took the lead with a try and a penalty kick. However, England quickly tied the game with six points. The second half was even more intense, with both teams closely matched and neither able to gain a significant advantage. With 15 minutes remaining, France took the lead, but England managed to snatch victory from the jaws of defeat with a try and a conversion kick. As a result, England won the match and moved up to second place in the standings, according to England coach Eddie Jones, 'It was a great team effort and a great win for us.'

**Scotland 18-32 Ireland: Eleventh heaven for Six Nations champions in bonus point victory**
Ireland maintained their perfect start to the 2025 Six Nations Championship with a 32-18 bonus point victory over Scotland at Murrayfield Stadium. The defending champions outplayed and outmuscled Scotland, who only threatened for a brief moment in the second half. Duhan van der Merwe scored a milestone try for Scotland, but the hosts ran out of steam, allowing Ireland to stretch their lead through James Lowe and Jack Conan. Ireland's 11th consecutive win over Scotland marked their 11th win in a row against the Scots, and they remain at the summit of the table with 10 points. Scotland, meanwhile, reside in fourth place with a five-point total.

**Italy Enforces a Dominant Win Over Wales in the Six Nations Championship**
Italy dominated Wales 22-15 in the second round of the 2025 Six Nations Championship at the Stadio Olimpico in Rome. The match was played in heavy rain, which made the conditions difficult for both teams. Italy's Tommaso Allan scored 13 points, including a penalty kick and a drop goal, to lead his team to victory. Wales struggled to find their rhythm and made several mistakes, including a yellow card for Josh Adams. Italy's Ange Capuozzo was a standout performer, making several crucial tackles and scoring a try. The win puts Italy in second place in the tournament, while Wales is in last place and is at risk of finishing with the wooden spoon. 'We played a great match,' said Italy's coach. 'The team showed a lot of character and determination.'

**The Best Six Nations Stats From Round 1**
The 2025 Six Nations kicked off with France hosting Wales, Scotland taking on Italy, and England visiting Dublin to face Ireland. France secured a 43-0 win over Wales, their second-biggest win against Wales since 1998. Antoine Dupont became the first player to provide a hat-trick of try assists in two separate Men's Six Nations matches. Thomas Ramos scored eight points against Wales, moving past Christophe Lamaison as France's second-top points scorer. Scotland won comfortably against Italy, with Huw Jones scoring a hat-trick and Darcy Graham beating 11 defenders. Ireland hosted England and secured a bonus-point win, despite trailing at half-time. Dan Sheehan's bonus-point clinching try was his ninth in the Six Nations, moving him level with Imanol Harinordoquy, Jamie Heaslip, and Charles Ollivon as the joint top try-scoring forward since Italy joined the Championship in 2000. James Lowe was the top player in Round 1 of this year's Men's Six Nations, according to the Opta Index, with a score of 8.5 out of 10.

The Six Nations Rugby 2025 tournament has concluded its first round, and the standings are already taking shape. France leads the pack after a dominant 43-0 victory over Wales, led by an unstoppable Antoine Dupont. Ireland edged out England 27-22 in the most highly anticipated match of the round, while Scotland secured a 31-19 win over Italy. The next round will take place next weekend. **Six Nations 2025: Calendar, Results, and Standings**
The Six Nations 2025 rugby tournament will take place from January 31 to March 15, 2025. The six participating teams are England, Wales, Scotland, Ireland, France, and Italy. The tournament has a annual schedule and is in its 26th edition with the 6-team format. The calendar is very tight, with each team playing a home and away match, alternating between even and odd years. The team that wins the Six Nations is the one that accumulates the most points in the standings, using a unique system called the 'Southern Hemisphere System'. For each win, 4 points are awarded, 2 for a draw, and 0 for a loss. Additionally, 1 bonus point is awarded to the losing team if the difference is less than 7 points, and to each team that scores at least 4 tries. A further 3 points are awarded to the team that wins all matches, guaranteeing them the tournament win. The current champion is Ireland, which has also won the most tournaments in the last 10 years. Italy has never won the tournament and often ends up with 0 points, earning the 'wooden spoon' award. Italy's first match is against Scotland, but attention is focused on the England-Ireland derby.

**2025 Six Nations Rugby Tournament: Schedule and Broadcast Information**
The 2025 Six Nations rugby tournament begins on Friday, January 31, with three matches. The first match features France, a favorite to win, against Wales at the Stade de France. On Saturday, Scotland will play Italy at the Scottish Gas Murrayfield, while Ireland, the defending champion, will face England at the Aviva Stadium in Dublin. The tournament format is similar to previous editions, with teams competing in a round-robin format and the team with the most points declared the champion. England has the most championship titles with 34, followed by Wales with 32, France with 26, Ireland with 20, and Scotland with 13. Italy is the only team that has never won the championship. The defending champion, Ireland, won the tournament in 2024 and 2023, while France won in 2022 with a Grand Slam. Wales won in 2019 and 2013, and in 2012 with a Grand Slam. England won in 2017 and 2016 with a Grand Slam, while Ireland won in 2015 and 2014. 'The result of this match can be decisive for the title aspirations of each team,' said the article. **France vs Wales Six Nations 2025 Prediction and Preview**
Wales face France in the opening match of the 2025 Six Nations, a game that France is heavily favored to win. France has won all three of their Autumn Nations Series matches, including a statement victory against the All Blacks. Wales, on the other hand, have lost their last 12 matches in a row. However, historically, Friday night tournament openers have been kind to the away side, with the visiting team winning on each of the previous four occasions. The kicking battle could be key in this match, with France averaging the most kicking metres of any Tier One nation in Test rugby last year. Wales, however, opted to kick more contestable kicks last year, with 15% of their kicks from hand coming via an up-and-under. France's weaknesses include conceding 3.4 points per 22 entry in the 2024 Championship, while Wales need to cause the opposition more problems in attack. The Opta supercomputer predicts a 38-17 win for France.

**Six Nations 2025 schedule, results, standings, format and scoring system for men's rugby union tournament**
Ireland is chasing an unprecedented third consecutive title in the 2025 Six Nations Championship. No team has achieved this feat since the competition expanded to its six-team format in 2000. The tournament format awards four points for a win, two for a draw, and zero for a loss, with bonus points available for scoring four tries or more, or losing by seven points or fewer. A Grand Slam, achieved by winning all five matches, earns three extra points. Ireland was on course for back-to-back Grand Slams before a last-gasp defeat to England in 2024. The tournament also features individual rivalry trophies and a Triple Crown for winning all three games against the other 'home nations' from the British Isles.

**Who won men's Six Nations 2024? Winners and final standings for rugby union tournament**
The 2024 Six Nations rugby union tournament has concluded, with Ireland winning their second consecutive title. However, their campaign was not without its setbacks, including a dramatic last-gasp loss to England at Twickenham. Scotland had a frustrating campaign, despite a 30-21 win over England, and finished in third place. Wales finished in last place after losing all five of their matches. England and France will be the main threats to Ireland's title defense in the 2025 Six Nations. 'It makes England's trip to Dublin on this year's opening weekend particularly mouth-watering,' according to the article. The 2025 Six Nations will take place from January 31 to March 15.

Source:[sportingnews.com](https://www.sportingnews.com/us/rugby-union/news/who-won-six-nations-2024-men-winners-final-standings-rugby/65d7d42a2e8ebe51e6ca1d46)

**Six Nations 2025: Are we living in the the rugby tournament's golden age?**
The Six Nations 2025 tournament is being hailed as the golden age of the competition. Italy's resurgence has made the tournament more competitive and entertaining, with a record 6.1 tries per game in 2023. The average winning margin in matches has dropped to an all-time low of 8.9 points in 2024, with 11 matches decided by fewer than 10 points. The unpredictability of the fixtures has increased, with home advantage being eroded and the title being shared four different ways since the turn of the decade. Scotland's current four-match winning streak against England is their longest in the countries' 154-year rivalry. The trend of increased try-scoring is partly due to rule tweaks and the introduction of bonus points, which has led to a premium on securing points by putting the ball down over the line rather than booting it between the sticks.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 27, 2025 12:24 PM
Source:[BBC](https://bbc.com/sport/extra/8ah6oemcah/Six-Nation-The-Golden-Age)

forecasters.initial_reasoning: Historically, the Six Nations Championship has often been competitive, with the top two teams frequently finishing close in points. Over the last decade, only about 20% of the tournaments have seen the winner finishing with 5 or more points above the second-placed team. This serves as the base rate for my initial probability estimate that the winner will finish with 5 more points than the second place.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Team Dominance
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: If there is a team that has been dominant in recent international matches leading up to the Six Nations, their performance might indicate a higher likelihood of them overpowering other teams and finishing with a significantly higher point total, potentially more than 5 points above the second place.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Competitive Balance
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Assessing the performance and rankings of teams in matches preceding the tournament can indicate a more balanced competition. If several teams appear similarly strong, the likelihood of one team finishing 5 points clear of the second place decreases.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Injury Reports
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: If a leading team suffers from significant injuries to key players, their chances of such a commanding win could diminish, which would reduce the probability of a large point differential.
